definition: to take for one's own/to expropriate
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: The crime by takingadvantage of duty includes illegal arrogation to oneself, use(embezzlement, misappropriation and abuse)and so on.
sentences.chinese: 侵财型职务犯罪包括非法据为己有和非法使用等类型。

sentences.english: Wang bing want to loan contract to purloin it grounds.
sentences.chinese: 王兵想以借款合同为由据为己有。

sentences.english: He hopes to pass a wolf the lamb glom on to in adjacent Yang Qun.
sentences.chinese: 他希望通过狼把邻近羊群中的小羊据为己有。

sentences.english: The portal strategy tries to own all of the information.
sentences.chinese: 而门户网站的战略是把所有的信息都据为己有。

sentences.english: The Rattlers staked their claim to the ball field by planting their flag in it.
sentences.chinese: 响尾蛇队在球场上插上自己的旗子，将其据为己有。

sentences.english: The thieves tried to double-cross each other each wanting to keep all the money for himself.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们互相欺骗，都想把所有的钱据为己有。

sentences.english: A stone so rare men will do anything to possess it.
sentences.chinese: 一块希罕的石头人们不惜一切代价将其据为己有。

sentences.english: To steal is to remove property from another person to oneself.
sentences.chinese: 偷窃是把另一个人的财物据为己有。

sentences.english: Many complain about private-equity firms keeping deal fees for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都在抱怨私募股权公司将交易费据为己有。

sentences.english: You should not appropriate other people's belongings.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把别人的所有物据为己有。

sentences.english: Then they had taken for themselves all the merchandise and bullock carts of the caravan.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们就把商队所有的货物和牛车据为己有。

sentences.english: By attempting to keep the money for themselves, Geng Fang and Geng Langang had committed a crime of embezzlement.
sentences.chinese: 为了把奖金据为己有，耿芳和耿朗刚犯了贪污罪。

sentences.english: The universe for granted as their own.
sentences.chinese: 理所当然地将宇宙据为己有。

sentences.english: When her uncle died, she grabbed everything she could get her hands on.
sentences.chinese: 她的叔叔死后，她把能弄到手的东西全部都据为己有。

sentences.english: He tried to swallow up the publicly-owned land.
sentences.chinese: 他企图把公共用地据为己有。

sentences.english: You should not appropriate other people's belongings to yourself without their permission.
sentences.chinese: 你不应未经同意把别人所有物据为己有。

definition: to appropriate to oneself (what rightfully belongs to others)
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to covet/to long for/to lust after
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
